detaileddescription.para: A group of V5 motors which act as one motor (i.e. they are mechanically linked). A MotorGroup requires at least one motor. If no motors are supplied, a std::invalid_argument exception is thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The motors in this group.
The logger this instance will log initialization warnings to.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::initializer_list< std::shared_ptr< AbstractMotor >> &imotors, const std::shared_ptr< Logger > &ilogger=Logger::getDefaultLogger())
memberdef.name: MotorGroup

detaileddescription.para: A group of V5 motors which act as one motor (i.e. they are mechanically linked). A MotorGroup requires at least one motor. If no motors are supplied, a std::invalid_argument exception is thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The motors in this group.
The logger this instance will log initialization warnings to.

detaileddescription.para: Motor movement functions These functions allow programmers to make motors move Sets the target absolute position for the motor to move to.
This movement is relative to the position of the motor when initialized or the position when it was most recently reset with setZeroPosition().

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The absolute position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the relative target position for the motor to move to.
This movement is relative to the current position of the motor. Providing 10.0 as the position parameter would result in the motor moving clockwise 10 units, no matter what the current position is.

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The relative position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the velocity for the motor.

This velocity corresponds to different actual speeds depending on the gearset used for the motor. This results in a range of +-100 for pros::c::red, +-200 for green, and +-600 for blue. The velocity is held with PID to ensure consistent speed, as opposed to setting the motor's voltage.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new motor velocity from -+-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the voltage for the motor from -12000 to 12000.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new voltage value from -12000 to 12000.

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Changes the output velocity for a profiled movement (moveAbsolute or moveRelative). This will have no effect if the motor is not following a profiled movement.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new motor velocity from -+-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Motor telemetry functions These functions allow programmers to collect telemetry from motors Gets the target position set for the motor by the user.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The target position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the absolute position of the motor in its encoder units.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's absolute position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the "absolute" zero position of the motor to its current position.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the velocity commanded to the motor by the user.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The commanded motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the actual velocity of the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's actual velocity in RPM or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the current drawn by the motor in mA.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's current in mA or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the direction of movement for the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: 1 for moving in the positive direction, -1 for moving in the negative direction, and PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the efficiency of the motor in percent.
An efficiency of 100% means that the motor is moving electrically while drawing no electrical power, and an efficiency of 0% means that the motor is drawing power but not moving.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's efficiency in percent or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the motor is drawing over its current limit.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: 1 if the motor's current limit is being exceeded and 0 if the current limit is not exceeded, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the motor's temperature is above its limit.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: 1 if the temperature limit is exceeded and 0 if the the temperature is below the limit, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the motor is stopped.

simplesect.para: Although this function forwards data from the motor, the motor presently does not provide any value. This function returns PROS_ERR with errno set to ENOSYS.
1 if the motor is not moving, 0 if the motor is moving, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the motor is at its zero position.
Although this function forwards data from the motor, the motor presently does not provide any value. This function returns PROS_ERR with errno set to ENOSYS.

simplesect.para: 1 if the motor is at zero absolute position, 0 if the motor has moved from its absolute zero, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno

detaileddescription.para: Gets the faults experienced by the motor. Compare this bitfield to the bitmasks in pros::motor_fault_e_t.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: A currently unknown bitfield containing the motor's faults. 0b00000100 = Current Limit Hit

detaileddescription.para: Gets the flags set by the motor's operation. Compare this bitfield to the bitmasks in pros::motor_flag_e_t.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: A currently unknown bitfield containing the motor's flags. These seem to be unrelated to the individual get_specific_flag functions

detaileddescription.para: Gets the raw encoder count of the motor at a given timestamp.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a time in milliseconds for which the encoder count will be returned. If NULL, the timestamp at which the encoder count was read will not be supplied

simplesect.para: The raw encoder count at the given timestamp or PROS_ERR if the operation failed.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the power drawn by the motor in Watts.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's power draw in Watts or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the temperature of the motor in degrees Celsius.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's temperature in degrees Celsius or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the torque generated by the motor in Newton Metres (Nm).
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's torque in NM or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the voltage delivered to the motor in millivolts.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's voltage in V or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Motor configuration functions These functions allow programmers to configure the behavior of motors Sets one of AbstractMotor::brakeMode to the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new motor brake mode to set for the motor

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the brake mode that was set for the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: One of brakeMode, according to what was set for the motor, or brakeMode::invalid if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the current limit for the motor in mA.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new current limit in mA

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the current limit for the motor in mA.
The default value is 2500 mA.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: The motor's current limit in mA or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets one of AbstractMotor::encoderUnits for the motor encoder.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new motor encoder units

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the encoder units that were set for the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: One of encoderUnits according to what is set for the motor or encoderUnits::invalid if the operation failed.

detaileddescription.para: Sets one of AbstractMotor::gearset for the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new motor gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the gearset that was set for the motor.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

simplesect.para: One of gearset according to what is set for the motor, or gearset::invalid if the operation failed.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the reverse flag for the motor.
This will invert its movements and the values returned for its position.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: True reverses the motor, false is default

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the voltage limit for the motor in Volts.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The new voltage limit in Volts

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

detaileddescription.para: Writes the value of the controller output. This method might be automatically called in another thread by the controller. The range of input values is expected to be [-1, 1].

parameterdescription.para: the controller's output in the range [-1, 1]

detaileddescription.para: Get the encoder associated with the first motor in this group.

simplesect.para: The encoder for the motor at index 0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the encoder associated with this motor.

parameterdescription.para: The index in motors to get the encoder from.

simplesect.para: The encoder for the motor at index.
